title: The Intelligence - “This is seen as protecting liberty, not imposing religious discrimination”—France’s secularism law
summary:
Also on the daily podcast: Taiwan’s economic turnaround and how managers can bring holiday cheer in a gloomy year“This is seen as protecting liberty, not imposing religious discrimination”—France’s secularism lawPRESIDENT EMMANUEL MACRON’S draft bill walks a fine line balancing the country’s foundational secularism and worries about Islamist terrorism.
Amid slumping economies everywhere, Taiwan’s looks surprisingly buoyant; we ask how that might continue after the pandemic.
And how managers can best navigate the holiday-party season in a cheerless year.
